1.q_string: When a system is taken from state '\(x\)' to state '\(y\)' then \(30 \mathrm{~kJ}\) of heat flows into the system and the system does \(10 \mathrm{~kJ}\) of work. When the system is returned from state '\(\mathrm{y}\)' to state '\(\mathrm{x}\)' along another path, then work done on the system is \(8 \mathrm{~kJ}\). What is the amount of heat liberated?

A reversible Carnot engine works between the temperature of \(1000 \mathrm{~K}\) and \(300 \mathrm{~K}\). Heat supplied to the engine by \(1000 \mathrm{~K}\) reservoir is \(250 \mathrm{~kJ}\). Now the work obtained by this engine is supplied to the refrigerator which works between the temperature limits of \(270 \mathrm{~K}\) and \(300 \mathrm{~K}\). The COP of the refrigerator is \(50 \%\) of the COP of the reversible refrigerator then find out the heat rejected by the refrigerator (in \(\mathrm{kJ}\) ) at the reservoir which is at \(300 \mathrm{~K}\).

In an adiabatic chamber, two blocks of the same mass and heat capacity comes in contact with each other. One is at a temperature of \(500 \mathrm{~K}\) and the other one is at \(1000 \mathrm{~K}\). Find the value of entropy change if the system attains thermodynamic equilibrium. Take (mass \(\left.=2 \mathrm{~kg}, \mathrm{C}_{\mathrm{p}}=1 \mathrm{~kJ} / \mathrm{kg} \mathrm{K}\right)\)

A gas is compressed at constant pressure from \(0.3 \mathrm{~m}^{3}\) and \(0.1 \mathrm{MPa}\) to \(0.15 \mathrm{~m}^{3}\). There is a transfer of heat of \(35 \mathrm{~kJ}\) from gas during the process. Find the change in internal energy during the process.
